headline: Delivering UNhappiness
pros: The brand name. Looks ok on the cv.
cons:
There is a lot of internal fighting over accounts. Everyone sells into each other's territory - no repercussions for this. There is internal bullying - this is also overlooked because all that really matters to this company are numbers. So let's talk about numbers- if you hit 150% of your quota, the following quarter's quota will inflate by 150%. Zoom give quarterly quotas and they are not strategic in how they decide upon the targets. Its just whatever you achieved previously becomes your new quota. The hiring has become so aggressive despite the demand for Zoom dwindling that each person's territory is shrinking WHILE their quota is increasing. 
There is no accountability. As an AE, you need to work closely with other stakeholders in order to Deliver Happiness to your customers. However, the culture at Zoom is very much one of 'passing the buck' or simply ignoring requests to collaborate which can seriously stall deals and ruin your opportunities to earn. People just don't want to help.
Your territory will change every time someone new is hired. You will have to accept that you will lose accounts month by month despite any opportunities you are working on. If a rep is caught selling into your account, you will be advised to split the booking with them, so you must accept that your accounts will be worked by others. 
Leadership are fully aware of all of the above as most reps are totally honest in the Glint surveys. Nothing has changed. 
There is no structure, just madness and chaos. There is no strategy, just greedy finance and sales ops who are trying their best not to pay out on commissions by increasing quotas to the point they are unattainable.
No career conversations which is fine cos who'd want a long tenure here?

headline: Great company if you're not in sales
pros:
Small 401k match, RSU's, unlimited time off if you're not hourly, friendly coworkers, great healthcare options, financial advisory service provided, mental health services, fertility benefit, reimbursement since we're not in office anymore for food/wellness, cell plan reimbursement, life insurance. High payouts IF you can exceed quota.

It's a fun company to work for given the culture they built.
cons:
If you are in sales I would look elsewhere. This company does not know how to set quotas properly. For the last year our division had quarters where 23, 40-50, and 67% of reps with a full quota hit quota (roughly). Because the division hits their numbers leadership doesn't care that so many are struggling. We are just here to fill the gaps so they don't have to pay us out fully but the division still looks good. As much as this company does to provide happiness to customers and employees in other aspects, they fall short here. You would think when 23% of people hit quota that they'd curve it but they didn't. Statistics don't lie, this company wants 60-70% of their reps to hit so that they don't have to pay out as much. Don't get excited when you see your base and OTE offer because it's HIGHLY unlikely that once you're off new hire quotas that you'll hit it. The people that do usually say they got lucky on some big deals. The RSU's are nice but a MAJOR tax burden to employees that the company gets a write off for. Morale is also down over our stock falling but there's not much the company can do there.

There are massive pay gaps amongst teammates carrying the same quotas. Some of us make 30-40k less between salary and OTE than others on our same team doing the same job, though for some it's more like 14k. This is unreal. They said they were going to level us over a year ago and it never happened. I don't even think our managers know what to do with that.

headline: Sales = sinking ship
pros: Eric is great - a great leader, great engineer, and great human.
cons:
-Sales policies regarding downsells, debooks, and commission payments feel unethical/immoral.  Zoom is making AE’s take debook and commission hits for deals the AE was never a part of initially, and was never paid on initially.  How can Zoom take commissions away when never paid to begin with?
-Sales ops:  Most AE’s spend a large part of their day managing broken accounts, and doing so with non-existent tools and processes.  This is the place to be if you want to become an expert in invoices, billing, statements, collections, and fixing licensing provisioning and other problems, rather than selling.  We cannot manage large, complex accounts via chat, opening tickets and tracking them, stalling our clients while we mess around with it internally, etc.)
-Quotas:  It is shocking how few reps (enterprise and majors) made the number.  The quotas are unrealistic and difficult to hit, especially when sales policies in place constantly work against the rep (see item 1).
-Leadership:  CRO is nice guy, but no smarter than average bear.  Exec under him is a highly paid cheerleader and little more.  The bright / good execs are leaving or have retired
-Strategy:  Our primary competitor did an excellent job putting a pricing and go-to-market strategy together against Zoom.  Zoom does not have a cohesive sales strategy at the moment (we are selling a platform talking about features/functions, we have no great answer to the competition we are currently facing, our sales motions are inviting prospects to a never ending series of webinars and cold calling, etc.).  It feels archaic and frantic/desperate.
-Support:  Support org and success org are backed up causing reps, SC/SE’s, and others in the field to try to support clients.  Again with nonexistent tools and processes.
-Morale:  Feels pretty low at the moment across the board.

headline: Fantastic company and culture, room for improvement in engineering
pros:
From the CEO down, leadership has been authentic and made best efforts to walk the walk. They answer hard questions/comments from employees, come up with solutions, then actually up and make sure it is working. 


For example, "No [Internal] Meeting Wednesdays." People were feeling burned out with meetings and they implemented this policy. While it was probably never meant to be a black and white rule, I guess it wasn't always being respected by different layers in the org. So the leadership has continued to revisit it and ensure it is actually being respected (even if there are some that don't follow it still).

My managers have also embodied these traits, even being proactive about noticing things like late meetings for our timezone, then reaching out to let us know we can push to have it recorded to respect our evenings.

I've yet to have an issue with a coworker, so far pretty much everyone has been talented and pleasant to work with. At least on my team, working remotely has been part of the DNA of the team, so I don't feel disadvantaged in any way being remote even in a different time zone than most.

The core "delivering happiness" value is also seen in our benefits. There may not be the same, perhaps excessive, benefits compared to other big tech companies, but they are still really good from my perspective. They feel generous and intentional.
cons:
Day to day work as an engineer leaves a bit to be desired. So many engineers and cross-functional team members are new to Zoom from the last year or two. There is a a lack of institutional knowledge in a lot of areas that leads to a fair amount of inefficiency with the product development process. Little information to go on at times, little dev environment or biz requirement issues that are hard to find someone that has the answers, etc. It has been somewhat difficult to drive significant fulfillment from the day-to-day work personally, so far.

Working with coworkers on the opposite side of the globe is difficult as well. While we do have support for maintaining a work-life balance, it is difficult to balance maintaining boundaries but also coordinating to ensure project success.

That being said, I don't believe this is unique to Zoom, and do believe in the active work being done to improve matters.

headline: So far so good... with room to improve!
pros:
I've been at Zoom for about a year now and here are my biggest 'pros' so far:
- People: we hire are hardworking, thoughtful, and scrappy individuals. The people I work with are hands down some of the most knowledgable and talented I've experienced in my career.
- Brand, Mission & Values: I love working for a company that has such great brand recognition and is truly changing the way people work and live for the better
- Products: are second to none and it's exciting to see how they are evolving to fit the new hybrid enviroment
- Benefits: it's evident Zoom truly cares about its employees. Our benefit package is generous, although there's room for improvement (no matching 401k!)
- Leadership Transparency: I love how regularly we hear updates from our executive team and appreciate their thoughtfulness in how they approach our All Hands and other meetings
- Work/Life Balance: I personally feel like I have work/life balance. I'm encouraged to take time off and it's clear leadership cares about my mental health and wellbeing.
- Flexibility: I appreciate how as long as I'm getting my work done, it generally doesn't matter from where, during what hours, etc. (within reason)
- Focus on DEI: Zoom does a fantastic job supporting DEI with our various ERGs and associated events
cons:
Here are some areas I think Zoom can improve:
- Internal Processes/Cross-Collaboration: while I wasn't here during 'peak' Covid, it's apparent a lot of structure and organization internally was put on pause just to keep the lights on at the company. There's a ton of work to be done to streamline processes, make data more reliable/available, and generally speaking with how teams work together instead of rowing in different directions
- Customer Centricity: linked to the above, all departments and teams should have goals/KPIs linked to customer success and customer happiness. It's very clear some departments care about the customer (particularly those on the front lines), while those behind-the-scenes often don't approach their work in a customer-centric way.
- Career Progression: is very opaque for me. I've never worked at a company where there isn't a formal performance review process and I don't have a strong sense of how bonus/pay/equity decisions are made
- Middle Management: insanely busy. I rarely meet with my manager and when I do, it's clear she's always distracted, not fully paying attention, and at times feels like she's using our time together to simply check the box. I wish we received more strategic vision/goals from our senior leaders.
- External Company Vision: candidly speaking, we do a very poor job of marketing ourselves as a 'platform' company, which is what the entire exec team would tell you we are trying to become/currently are. Everyone knows us for our Meetings product because most have used it, but few are aware we have products outside of Meetings. We could do a lot better job of painting a picture to investors/prospective customers/current customers about how we position ourselves and product suite as a platform, not a single product.
- M&A: what are we doing here? We clearly have a lot of cash on the balance sheet and the Five9 deal fell through. I appreciate the diligent approach to our financials, which has undoubtedly put us in the great position we're in today, but I actually question if we're being too stringent with our cash reserves?

It will take forever to share but here's the summary
- HR- Many interviewees and existing employees who were interviewed had very bad experience. Other than that HR is non-existence, almost forgot there is a HR function in this company. 
- Sales- Runs like SME, Wild Wild West, do what you want because no one cares as long as you hit your numbers. There are many rules in place but no one follows or even enforce them. The structure can just change without discussing with the team involved because the top management approved it as long as you pitch the right information he wants to hear. One of the messiest sales team. Many leaders are good in theory and storytelling, very few that really understand what is happening on the ground or maybe they don’t even care at all as long as you deliver the numbers. Managers who set direction but always changed due to lack of confidence(capabilities) and pressure from the top.
- Sales Ops- Does it exist? I thought they are interns that just know how to copy and paste excel sheets whenever people ask them to do so, a team with 0 values, database and account are in a mess and getting worst everyday
- Operation- Billing, IT, etc, sometimes your questions or ticket logged will never be resolved. Everyone is pushing responsibilities because many of them are contractors. You will end up at a dead-end and not sure what to do next because even the expert in the department pushes it back to you.

Overall:
- No transparency in this company, any information you ask for will never have an answer, such as how we set our quota/target, how they evaluate the market, which data are we using etc. Structure and strategy can just change without involving or even communicating to the people who are affected. Top management can just decide and execute. You only realise the changes when it hit on your face.
- Love to use the excuse of “growing too fast”, “growing pain” for not improving, nothing has changed, but many things turn out to be worst.

headline: Used to be great. Now 24-7 work and process nightmares.
pros:
Great benefits, perks, communication from leaders, and peer level teammates. 

Eric is a truly great CEO who cares about employees as individuals. He has his faults (priority pivoting too frequently, some micromanaging) but I believe in him as a leader.

The core zoom products/platform are really, really strong (meetings, chat, phone, rooms). I use zoom tools all day. I believe in a very strong future for the platform and the company.
cons:
Since covid, you cannot take a breath. Every day there is some kind of crisis or urgent priority. Priorities shift so often that you get whiplash. Everything should be done "yesterday", and long hours are the norm. Regular planning cycles are a joke because no one has the foresight to know what will be asked of you in a month much less next quarter. 

The culture has significantly degraded from its pre covid days. This used to be a fun, joyful, and collaborative place. Now everyone is burnt out and passes the buck (not my problem, talk to this other person). Processes are bogging us down so much, and new processes are introduced with no training or analysis on how it will affect workload and time to market. Yet still everything is expected to get done overnight. 

Management talks about the book Speed of Trust but won't implement that way of thinking. Every decision and contract is micromanaged, so subject matter experts cannot control their own programs.

headline: Defining the Future of Work
pros:
Though Zoom is post-IPO, we are largely still in the process of transitioning from a startup culture to a more mature and structured 10-year-old company. This is a prime opportunity for professional growth, exposure to leadership, and the ability to put your name on your contributions.
The benefits are amazing, but that's not why you come here. You come to grow in ways you never could in your existing job.

This is why I joined and it is already paying off!
cons: Zoom has grown so fast in the last year that there are natural growing pains to overcome. Those who will thrive here must have a growth mindset, the ability to deal with ambiguity, and patience, as Zoom is heading for its next exciting adventure. Some managers are new in the role and need some training, which has rolled out last year. We just need the patience to see the hard work pay off in the next year.

headline: Still the best, but with growing pains
pros: Great benefits, the best CEO, great culture, and the best product. Easy to reach out and get help from any team you need. Company is understanding about time off (though with high quotas it's a little hard to warrant time off) and accepts input from employees. One of the few companies left I think that actually reviews all-hands submitted questions and answers them. They seem to take employee feedback seriously. Very focused on diversity & inclusion, though as most tech companies are, Zoom seems to be more liberal/democratic minded than conservative/independent/republican friendly. You have the benefit of working for a company that is helping to change the world. They give us great sales tools, and the equipment we need. Once you've made friends they're great here, but it's still hard to come in as a new employee and burst the small family bubble that existed. Excellent shift of benefits during COVID since not needing to host lunch in the office etc.
cons: MASSIVE pay gaps between employees with the same experience levels on the same teams carrying the same quotas. Leveling has not taken place as we were told it would and it creates serious friction between teammates, to the point where some employees will probably seek other employment if vested. Some of these gaps are "small" at 13k between base and commission, and some are as large as 47k from what employees are aware of. I truly believe Eric Yuan has the BEST intentions and goals, but some of the other executive leaders coming in from other companies are carrying their intentions/ideas with them. Ryan for example adjusted the clawback period and extended it during COVID so that employees took huge hits on cancellations when we knew people were going to go up and down on subscriptions due to the state of the business. Bringing in Cisco and RC leadership has had a negative impact all around. Quotas appear to be mis-aligned and leadership seems to have forgotten that the Zoom Boom is over. You aren't supposed to miss quota, but supposedly they're also set so that only X% of employees hit, which doesn't make sense. No 401k Match right now. A lot of outside hiring was done for promotions available during covid rather than promoting within and starting brand new people at the bottom, which seemed like a slap in the face to Zoomies who have been here for years. There has been a lot of talk about going back to the office, which seems hypocritical given that we are THE work from anywhere company. There is a lot of uncertainty for employees here right now, which would be more understandable if we were any other company, but none of us should be forced into a hybrid option when we return. Leadership is not on the same page and some make it seem like you won't have a job if you don't return to the office, while others make it seem like remote work will be fine. Our territories in sales are a disaster. We need these to be better aligned and graded.

headline: Best Company I Have Ever Worked For (like, not even close)
pros:
This company truly has a vison to change the world, for the better. It is the most collaborative workforce I have ever seen. The standards for employees helping each other on literally an hourly basis are incredibly high...but that was not set by management, it is the employees who hold ourselves to these standards. We are growing to be a very large family, but there is no one in the company at any level that I don't feel like I could reach out to with a concern, question, or compliment. Even at 4,000 strong we all feel very close and it's something that other companies talk about, but I have never truly experienced it like I do at Zoom....and I have worked for several multi-billion dollar SaaS companies. I always say we are very spoiled, emotionally speaking (and often with food and money too). Our CEO is probably one of the nicest people you will ever meet. Our leadership most of the time exudes humility, happiness, and proudness in their staff.

Zoom has ruined me for other companies :)

headline: Mostly amazing
pros:
-  Market leader with frequent updates and innovation
- Massive market awareness and most clients love us
- Overall competitive package when factoring in RSUs
- Great sales tech stack
- Unparalleled commission and perks structure, better than I've seen at any tech company
- High hiring standard means most colleagues are capable, smart and helpful
- Mostly realistic ramp period and targets, though this appears to be changing a bit with the Zoom Boom
- Extremely flexible and accommodating with COVID
- Massive focus on creating a helpful, caring and inclusive team culture at all levels of the company
- Frequent gifts, events and surprises 
- Excellent online knowledge base, takes two seconds to find an answer for a customer most of the time
- Massive flexibility to approach deals the way you want with minimal red tape or quota retirement penalties
cons:
- Not necessarily a con, but life at Zoom is extremely fast paced and it may be hard for some to keep up 
- Base salaries are definitely on the low side and could use a review, though the perks, RSUs and commission structure mostly make up for this
- The culture is shifting towards a more corporate environment, inevitable with such large growth, but definitely needs to be managed appropriately
- Clawback structure needs a fairness revamp. As it currently stands it heavily discourages reps from selling an entire product category. 
- Marketing needs a boost to combat Teams and raise market awareness of Zoom Phone. General market awareness shouldn't be a rep's job. 
- Support and sales ops need more resources
- CRM needs to be managed better. Lots of duplicate and dead accounts/contacts so territories are distorted. I'd say only about 30% of my accounts can genuinely be sold to. 
- Currently there doesn't seem to be much ability to move between departments (jumping from Sales to Sales Enablement etc), though initiatives like Zoom Bloom appear to be addressing this

The people and teams I have personally worked with have been fantastic. The strong connection I had with all the people I met during my hiring process was a major selling point when choosing Zoom, and my impression has not changed.

So many awesome fringe benefits! Some jobseekers like to think that they'd rather have an extra couple thousand in salary, but the value that these benefits bring for motivation, encouragement, and personal growth cannot be replaced with incremental cash that you would never even think about. Some benefits aren't even advertised -- fireside chats with famous business leaders and celebs, monthly treats, random gifts...
cons:
If you can get an offer from all the top tech companies, Zoom's comp probably won't be the highest.

While working from home is not uncommon on an occasional basis, working fully remote is not an option for most roles. (There are exceptions, but very rare for non-sales.)

Some teams do not yet have a clearly defined career path for all roles.

headline: A Dream Job and Culture
pros:
BENEFITS:
+Very generous health and wellness benefits that go beyond most company benefits policies. This includes gym reimbursement,  free mental health counseling, free book reimbursement, lunch served 4 days a week, a fully stocked kitchen in each office, free virtual workout sessions, and much more.

+Ridiculously low healthcare insurance costs (you get to choose between HSA, PPO, or HMO [if in CO or CA]),

+We also have MTO (unlimited time off) and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) which you can put 20% of your paycheck towards for a 15% discount on Zoom stock.

+RSUs are provided to new employees to vest over 4 years and you don't have to purchase them!

+Even if you didn't get hired pre-IPO for Zoom, we are just getting started on being #1 in our industry worldwide. There's a lot more money to be made from any department member at Zoom if you want to make a 10 or 20 year career at Zoom.  Every employee at Zoom does make a difference internally and with how we are received by our customers. 


AS A SALES TEAM MEMBER:
+High energy sales team in most offices, especially San Jose and Denver. We have high expectations for our team members to work hard, put in a solid 8 hours a day, and deliver customer happiness. What does customer happiness look like? It means getting on Zoom meetings with your customers/prospects and being able to solution sell the benefits of Zoom's meeting, room, and phone technology. Get a customer in a trial + have great follow up/customer service and you have a good chance of winning the customer over. The product sells itself!!!

+There are so many resources to count. You have a dedicated Phone Product Specialist that will help you on any Zoom Phone deals and they have competitive info that can give our customers confidence in testing our phone product. Also, you have access to a solution engineer for any pre-sales opportunities so that you don't have to be technical with the product. We have partners who can help you through the channel of resell and hardware partners. We also have a dedicated CSM team that will help you train your higher paying accounts with training and onboarding.

+Managers want you to be successful. They will not make every sales person happy but the good ones (there's a lot of them) will fight for you when it comes to quota relief, bookings, conflicts with other sales members, difficult customers, and escalating requests to leadership and other departments. My manager does all of this and more. She knows the strengths of our team and is always figuring out new ways to engage our team and connect us. Funny part about this whole COVID-19 and working from home is that our team is actually closer now than ever before. And this is because of my manager. She brings the best out of us.

+As big as Zoom is getting, you still have access to leadership to help you. A simple ping and hop on a Zoom meeting with even our CEO is possible at Zoom. A lot of employees don't realize this. On top of this, our leadership team is very transparent in listening to our concerns.

+Promotions are up for grabs every quarter. I've been promoted several times because I applied and prepared for my internal interviews with hiring managers. If you really want it and show through your work ethic and performance, Zoom will promote you and increase your income/salary/stock rewards.


PRODUCT:
+It just works! Have you tested our competitors? Imagine if you couldn't use Zoom anymore? How devastated would you be in being able to get things done?

+Zoom allows our employees to add/suggest/escalate product requests no matter what level position you have. We use a company called UserVoice to up or down vote product/feature enhancements and concerns. You can put in your own suggestion and it may find its place on the Zoom product roadmap. It's newly implemented in the past 6 months so I am excited to see what that looks like by the end of 2020.

+We have an exceptional product that I believe some employees don't even realize. Many of our competitors do not innovate at the pace that Zoom does. Our engineering teams are working 24/7 around the world to develop Zoom. Our engineers in San Jose are the BEST in the world at what they do. I'd highly recommend every employee to visit our San Jose office and get a tour of the engineering floor.  Meet some of the men and women who work on the product and then talk to our product team led by Oded. You will be AMAZED to hear what we are working on. The future is not too far away with Zoom's roadmap.
cons:
+We have MTO (unlimited time off) - only con is that we can get so busy and passionate about our work at Zoom that it's difficult to take off without lettings work stack up and projects get delayed. Customers need us!

+No 401k match yet - but it's not that big of a deal because we have the ESPP and RSU plans!

Eric values and appreciates his employees and understands that if we are HAPPY - we will truly DELIVER HAPPINESS to our customers. We CARE about our customers, we care about each other, we care about our teammates, we care about our community. Eric always wants to do the right thing - for his employees, for our customers, shareholders, and for the world. Zoom is transforming the way people collaborate and communicate and Eric wants to help as many people as possible have access to our technology to make the world a better place. At first glance, I can understand how some people would perceive these statements as cheesy. Once you are actually here experiencing the culture, you will understand the value of what it means to DELIVER HAPPINESS!

headline: Best Job with the Greatest CEO
pros:
I've worked at Zoom for a little over two years.  Before joining the team I spent much of my time evaluating leadership through online content.  After many hours of watching YouTube videos of Eric Yuan (external interviews & internal marketing content), I quickly knew that this was the type of leader that I wanted to work for.  He seemed to be a genuine, thoughtful, caring individual that wanted to better connect the world. And that's the truth - Eric is freaking awesome!

Over the past 27 months, I cannot recall a single decision made by Eric that I have not supported.  He was been nothing but thoughtful, caring, and empathetic to his workforce, clients, and the greater community.  I would take a bullet for that man.

As far as other leaders within the organization, the vast majority share his core value of CARE.  The team is always doing the best that they can to put the interest of the employees first. 

The day-to-day in my role has been very fun & rewarding.  Zoom has built a brand that customers trust, so overall the sales/customer relationships have been fantastic!  It's rare to have to deal with clients that are upset with us, which makes the daily grind easy.

Overall, it's the best job I've ever had, and highly recommend working for Zoom.
cons:
We've had significant growth over the years, and that of course comes with challenges.  It's difficult to maintain the start up culture feel when you're on-boarding so many new hires each month.  Therefore, if you're looking for that start up culture, at this stage, I do not feel that Zoom will provide that.  We do our best, but it's just not the same when an organization has 10s/100s of employees vs 1000s.

Some of the new leadership have fallen short in making decisions that align to Zoom's core values, but overall, it has not been tremendously damaging to my experience at Zoom.  It's more along the lines of corp change that comes with growth, and I believe any organization would struggle with this.

headline: Happy and Delivering Happiness

Company culture and emphasis on work-life balance and happiness of employees are not just slogans, they are the core values. At Zoom, executives believe that if the employees are taken care of, then they will take care of the clients. 
The product is the best and when you face clients every day who are very pleased with the product and keep coming back for more or write thank you notes, it gives you so much satisfaction and makes you get up every day to strive for more. This is multiplied by millions now during this strange time. 
Business process and structure in departments are designed the best to fit each department and hence interactions among the different functional departments are quick and efficient in most cases. People truly work as a team and opinions are respected and implemented if appropriate and in sync with the direction of the department.
Thanks to everyone at Zoom for working so hard and making a difference in the world.

headline: I have won the lottery
pros: Having worked for Zoom for over 4 years (always in sales), I can truly say I have won the lottery. Since I started, Zoom continues to stay focused and committed to  delivering happiness to employees, customers, investors and now pretty much the entire world. It is amazing I had to  explain “who Zoom was” a mere 4 years ago to now seeing it be used by EVERYONE to stay connected.  Recently leadership rolled out ZoomCares which gave a matching bonus to EVERY Zoom employee to make a donation to their charity of choice. Our leadership team did have to make a difficult decision to adjust our comp plans due to the incredible unprecedented demand we have seen due to COVID. But this is business! Reps are still likely going to make the biggest pay check of their lives (while others are losing their job). Outside of sales, we have a dedicated incredible team in all roles across the company working tirelessly to support our customers. It is truly humbling to see the commitment of everyone working at Zoom.
cons: We have grown and continue to grow at a rapid pace. There can be a lot of noise because of this. It does come from the right place, so it isn’t a con but more of an opportunity to continue to streamline communication both internally and externally.

I was so honored that zoom gave me the opportunity to prove myself and 3 years later I have gone from an SDR to a Team Lead and now a Sales Leader just over a year ago. While that may or may not be the typical trajectory for everyone that comes to Zoom,  I have been so proud to be given the opportunities I have been given since I have been here

Long list, but here are all the things I LOVE about Zoom!

- great Company Culture (Always having fun at work and with events outside of work)
- Many opportunities to grow professionally with a fast-growing company.
- Support from Leaders all over the organization
- Supportive and uplifting teams that want to see each other succeed
- Transparency from all levels of leadership ( We host monthly all-hands where people submit questions online anonymously and receive responses from Senior Leadership and many cases immediate action in response to questions/comments
- Zoom supports a work-life balance with great options for taking time off as well as AMAZING benefits.  
- Company support GREEN Initiatives and makes sure we are taking measures for sustainability in the workplace
- Free Catered Lunches 4 days a week and Free Snacks throughout the workweek
cons: - Growing pains sometimes are more prominent the faster we grow and we are growing FAST,

headline: Simply the"Patriots Way" in the Corporate World, With Happiness!!!!
pros:

Started by an unbelievably humble but extraordinarily intelligent man Zoom strives to deliver happiness to its customers. Happy customers = happy employees = exponential growth! Here are a few things I love about working at this company. 

1) The culture - I've never worked at a place where people are always smiling and will stop what they are doing to introduce themselves (CEO included). Everyone is very willing to help, and I feel like being part of a team here rather than just a company. 

2) Familiarity / Reputation - As an account manager who's sold plenty of products from companies you've never heard of, it's a breath of fresh air when speaking with prospects and strangers who know about your company and what you do. Even better, they LOVE the product! I always get stopped at the airport when wearing my Zoom t-shirt or backpack. 

3) Office - if you've ever worked for a bay area tech company you will understand what I'm talking about. They have a good stock of snacks, amazing coffee machine, and even an infused water dispenser. To boot, they provide a lunch allowance for the awesome cafeteria downstairs for 4 days a week. 

4) The Leadership- We work with genuine people, who listen to your concerns and implement action when necessary. There is no competition amongst managers, just a well-coordinated team executing on the plays. Finally the CEO, who after being surrounded when he concluded took time to answer everyone's questions after sincerely listening to what his employees had to say.
cons: Onboarding is a little tough out of the gate because you are expected to produce right away while having to attend mandatory training meetings and complete mandatory training modules. Still, they are helpful and the discussions always leave you better than where you started, but they can really fill up a day.

headline: A company who cares for everyone.

- Excellent co-workers.  Everyone is always extremely nice and always willing to help you with anything you may need.  I've bothered people on their days off and they would still answer me.  

- Everyone is treated equally.  Bottom line, they treat you like a grown up.  They cater food for you and all they want in return is to throw your own plate away and pick up after yourself if you make a mess.  Just like you would at your own house.   They are not our maids, so just be respectful.  You also get beverages, snacks, coffee, etc etc.  Get ready to put on your freshmen 15!

- Promotions every where.  I joined the team in December and so far I've seen 4 promotions to team leads, 1 to CSM, 1 other to another senior level role and another to our IT department.  That's just on our Technical Support Engineering team!  I've never had this experience at any company.  Normally it takes a few years before they even consider you for any other position.  Kudos to Zoom on this one!

- Respect.  Never heard any bad talk about anyone.  Everyone is courteous to each other and will respect your boundaries.  My last job we had a lot of cross talk and gossip all over.  I haven't heard anything since I joined here.   

-  Money.  Great competitive pay.  I worked at a company for 5 years just making more than I do now, but with the bonuses/weekend work here, I'm going to surpass that this year easily.
cons: One con and I'm not even sure it's a con, is they will only let you work 2 weekends in a row then you need to take one off.  This is to prevent you from burning out.  Hey, I get it, they don't want you to get burned out.  Makes sense, I just wish I could work more.

headline: Awesome work environment, Amazing Work Culture
pros:
I wanted to wait to write a review because I wanted to make sure that I could provide a thorough review of the full experience.  Having read the company reviews, I was surprised by how almost cultishly enthusiastic the workers have been.  However, after having been here through a full year, I can say without hesitation that this company has been a great place to work and everyone with very few exceptions have been as much of a pleasure to work with as the reviews state.  It's exciting to be a part of the growth, to see the company develop new processes and innovations and to be a part of the solution.  The work culture that has been developed really has been the lifeblood of the company.  The company motto of "Delivering Happiness" really is a part of the work here, and it is not just lingo.  In making every decision, from deciding company benefits, to deciding whether or not to pursue a business deal, from the CEO to the new employee, we are encouraged to consider whether we are "delivering happiness" to the customer.  Work life balance is good.  While Zoom is a start up company requiring its employees to wear a lot of hats and fulfill a lot of different roles and responsibilities, this too is a bit of a benefit in that there are always new roles to step into and new and exciting work experiences to grow from.  Company management is not looking to point fingers and to assign blame; people genuinely care for each other and are looking to further the company and each other's needs.  It's been about as fun and enjoyable an experience as work can be.  
     The management go out of their way to reward hard work and to assign credit.  They are always looking for ways to provide new opportunities for the company and for individuals to grow.  They look to push the envelope on growing while staying true to the company roots, delivering happiness to everyone.
cons: As a startup, resources do not always compare the the "huge" companies, but management always tries to compete.

headline: Best job on Earth
pros: You are a human at this company and they really care about you as a person! Company culture, work/family balance, CEO's #1 goal is happiness, great product, great employees, great customers, fast growing company, growth opportunities, excellent pay and benefits.

cons: Can't think of anything right now.

headline: Best company I've ever worked for!
pros: Great product, great leadership, great atmosphere, open & forward thinking.
cons: We're growing so fast I can't keep up with all the new employees!

headline: Zooming!
pros: Unique Culture, Great flexible schedule/off policy, encourages professional growth
cons: Don't be growing too fast ;-)

headline: Gets better all the time
pros: Every day is a new win, a new milestone in this high growth company. The people are really special here and truly dedicated to our customers. Many opportunities to stretch yourself and do big things. Management has also put a lot more effort the past couple years into benefits and work environment - we feel truly valued.
cons: Typical growing pains - everyone is doing multiple jobs and working really hard while we staff up aggressively  - but this is also a positive if you're looking to grow your career.

headline: All about Happiness!
pros: From the top down this place is all about delivering happiness.  That is the slogan for the company btw. It is about delivering happiness to customers and to each other (employees). You might think this is a bunch of insincere hype, but as a person working here, you really feel that. The company really cares about your personal growth and well being.
cons: There is really not much cons

headline: A+ culture, happy customers, all made possible by great people and great product
pros: Phenomenal growth, everyone has bought into truly caring about our customers, still small relative to customer base/revenue so plenty room to grow
cons: If you thrive on strict structure may not be the place for you,  you need to be self-motivated to succeed here

headline: Amazing place to work, though some benefits could be improved
pros: Fantastic leadership. Product you can stand behind. Rocket ship of a company. Lot's of room for personal and career growth.
cons: Overall, extremely happy and not looking to move anytime soon, but the maternity and paternity benefits are behind what you'd expect for a Silicon Valley company. The org structure is too flat.

headline: Smart people, killer product, and a fun environment
pros:
I have been at Zoom for about a year and have been impressed with the company culture from the start. There is a strong focus on community, and it is amazing to come to work every day knowing that your peers, managers, and executives care about your livelihood, rather than your contribution to their bottom line. 

The Sales environment, which I am a part of, is focused, competitive, and resourceful. However, we work as a team to train up new employees, close deals and discover new strategies. 

The executive team is truly First Class. Very transparent, and easily accessible since the organizational structure is very flat. 

There are too many good things to say about Zoom. Competitive pay, a lot of Free Zoom swag to wear, and sponsored lunches 3 days per week are just icing on the cake to an all-star environment
cons: Typical startup problems and growing pains, sometimes as a sales professional, you feel the pressure to overwork/stay longer than is right for you.

headline: Great company to work in
pros: It is happy to work here. Everyone is helpful and friendly. Free lunch provided!
cons: A little bit crowded now, however, we will have another floor in the building  in two weeks!

headline: Culture is definitely one of Happiness!  Everyone is helps and appreciates one another
pros: I've only been on the job for a very short time but from what I can tell, the company atmosphere is definitely one of spreading Happiness.  Co-workers seem to check their egos at the door, help each other out and just the appreciation everyone shows for each other is just amazing and contagious.  It's an exciting atmosphere and a completely new area for me.  A driving force in the future of communication and technology, just the shear talent is amazing.
cons: I think the only con is growth.... growing fast.  The momentum is there but just keeping up with organizing the role-out for that growth.

headline: A company like no other
pros:
- Amazing culture
- Complete transparency
- The ability to innovate  & inspire
cons: I really cannot say anything negative at this time.

headline: Best of the Best
pros:
Flexible work environment. Transparent leadership. Intelligent colleagues. Unbeatable product. Interesting and rewarding work. 

I've worked at multiple public companies and NOTHING has come close to beating the culture and product of Zoom.
cons: None, that I can think of at this time.

headline: Business Development Representative
pros: Fantastic work environment and great people
cons: Haven't been able to identify a flaw yet

headline: Amazing Company
pros: Zoom has an amazing work culture. Everyone shows up to the office each day in a great mood, ready to spread happiness. I have worked in technology for over a decade and I have never seen anything like Zoom. Eric Yuan is a humble leader and he leads by example. Zoom is an amazing SaaS product and everyone at Zoom truly believes in the product. I am looking forward to a long future with Zoom, spreading happiness to our customers.
cons: I cannot think of a single negative thing to say in this space. Zoom is an amazing company with a great culture. Zoom understands that happy workers translates to happy customers.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Best place to work!!
cons: I have no cons for this company

headline: Believe the hype!
pros:
Believe the hype! The culture and product are exactly as advertised. I thought people were drinking the Kool-Aid when I first joined the team. Now I'm saying "the Kool-Aid tastes gooood". 

It really is an exciting time at Zoom. The product is disrupting and taking over the industry. Management is engaged, open, and have set a culture that few companies can match.
cons: Honestly none. Product sells itself. The growth hasn't been a negative. Denver office has exponential growth, and maintains its culture.

headline: Innovation Innovation Innovation
pros: There is nothing better than working for a company that is always pushing the limits of innovation and being at the forefront of the future of collaboration
cons: There are only a limited number of hours in a day that I can show people our innovation and what the future holds

headline: AE
pros: Culture and People are amazing, Pay is great, Product is the best on the market!
cons: Don't think there are any

headline: AV Installer
pros:
Wonderful work culture






















































Great work culture, easy/transparent access to senior management, and full in-house training with some of Silicon Valley's best leaders.
cons: Currently doesn't match 401K benefits.

headline: Excellent Place to Work with Room to Improve
pros: This company has great values with the mission, Deliver Happiness. This is really the core of the company and they try to deliver employees happiness too with regular in-office lunches. They pay well, insurance benefits are great, and there is a lot of opportunity for career growth.
cons: The benefits could be improved for parents, like better paternity, maternity, and adoption leave. There could also be more opportunities to work remotely.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Great leadership and vision.  Amazing culture.  The rumors are real with Zoom!
cons: Does not match 401K but that's it.

headline: Why I love to work at Zoom
pros:
I have never worked for any company/organization that has been so involved with donating time and other resources inside and outside of the community.  This feels so good!

Zoom has a "Delivering Happiness Crew" that is not just a memo on a peg board.  It is real and I see the service everyday!  I had never experienced this in prior employment.

This culture has improved my growth with new challenges and it has been super fun!

My family has greatly benefitted from my employment at Zoom, doesn't get any better than that in my estimation.
cons: I wish I worked here sooner.

headline: Account Executive
pros:
The culture here is amazing
We have an amazing product, which makes selling it even easier
The executive team is extremely approachable and willing to help anyone of their employees
Lunch is available 3x a week
cons: Still technically a start up, and there are some growing pains

headline: Account Executive
pros: Love the transparency from the executive team.  It's pretty powerful at such a fast growing company.  We are still able to maintain our amazing culture.
cons: Hope we can maintain the culture as we scale our fast growth and goals as a company

headline: Progressive and Real
pros: sense of community, best work environment, team work, Happiness is real
cons: If you are not prepared for a company that follows through on its core values, and is progressive, and fast paced, Zoom may not be a good fit.

headline: Zwow!
pros: The People. I capitalize that for a reason.  Love coming to work.  Technology is incredible and I use it outside of work all the time.  Give you all the tools and support to be successful.  Management is unbelievably supportive and access to execs is open-door (or over Zoom).
cons: No dogs at HQ sucks but we have to play nice with San Jose city

headline: Incredible Company
pros: Management and team members extremely responsive to customers and each other.   Everyone is very positive and upbeat.  Good blend of expertise and work backgrounds.  Low stress environment and everyone looks out for one another.  Great management starting with the CEO and President.  Very transparent.  Spends/saves money in the right places.   Customers love the product.  Nice perks like location (San Jose HQ)/paid parking, free lunches, company outings, several ways to make money in sales, etc.  By far the best company I've been a part of.  Once in a career type of place.
cons: Same as any other private just-beyond-startup-phase type company who's growing extremely fast.  Continuing to maintain the great culture, while finding the right people, while keeping our customers happy as they are today, are all huge challenges.  Great problems to have.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Best career decision I have ever made in my life.  Enjoy my coworkers and management.
cons: We are growing so fast it is hard to recognize faces.

headline: Working for Zoom
pros: Best company culture I've experienced in my career. Amazing people. Fun events. Catered lunches.  Plus its great selling a product people love, it pretty much sells itself.
cons: Quotas are constantly raising which is stressful. Working from home is frowned upon.

headline: Exciting Organization - Endless Opportunity
pros: Experienced and successful leadership team; Engaged company culture- no question or request is insignificant; Opportunity to voice comments, concerns, questions; Incredibly well designed and engineered collaboration platform; Generous and competitive compensation packages
cons: Expectation that everyone is on Pacific Time

headline: If you want to work for the best company & with the best people, look no further!
pros:
•	Amazing culture! Unlike other places I have worked, I do not feel that there are many politics. Everyone is treated equally and your voice is heard. All the offices are amazing and filled with great people. I feel spoiled by how great they treat us (trips, happy hours, team outings, catered lunches 3 days a week, in office snacks and drinks, end of quarter they give out amazing prizes, zoom swag, casual dress code, and so much more)!

•	Sell an amazing product! Every time I get to show someone Zoom that has never experienced the power it has to offer I get excited. It's truly the best in the market which makes it not only fun to sell but you feel confident in everything you are selling.

•	Management! The management team is outstanding and everyone is more than happy to help whether you report to them or not. They all truly care and it's great feeling that your manager has your back.

•	Tools! Zoom is always evaluating new tools/processes to make our lives easier.
cons:
•	Focus more on promoting from within - not saying this does not happen because it does but the process can be drawn out. However, I also understand we are currently trying to get some of the best talent in the industry to join our team but we need to make sure to focus on the talent internally first and getting them to where they want to be.

•	401K which will come with time

•	Constant change - this is a given when working for a quickly growing startup but at times can be frustrating.

headline: Best. Job. Ever.
pros:
I absolutely love what Zoom's core mission is: Delivering Happiness. This means to its people, customers, community.. you get the idea. 

I have never been apart of a company where people are genuinely happy to come in every day and are eager to help their teammates. Zoom has built an amazing company culture, which is impressive considering the rapid growth. It really has been the most positive experience in my career. 

Not only is the culture amazing, but the PRODUCT is leaps and bounds ahead of anything I have experienced at other companies. When I talk to the customers I hear that they are happy with not only the quality and the fact that it actually works, but that they feel taken care of and heard by Zoom. 

It also doesn't hurt that we are backed by Sequoia.

All and all, if anyone has a chance to become apart of this company- DO IT!
cons: Because we have had such rapid growth, it's hard to find places for people to get set up at. We just got another floor in the building though, so this problem should be solved for now.

headline: Sales Rep
pros: Customers and employees believe in our products - makes it easy to sell and positively impacts people every day; strong company culture and positive attitudes across the org; hard work but great compensation
cons: As the org grows fast, hoping sacrifices won't have to be made in company culture or individual opportunities; some internal processes could be more streamlined and easier

headline: Delivering Happiness to Our Customers, Our Team, and Ourselves
pros: Zoom is an incredible company. Leadership is engaging, accessible, and accountable. Truly collaborative culture across all teams (Sales, Success, Support, Product). Freedom to Deliver Happiness to internal and external partners in any (reasonable) way without micromanagement. Customers love the product and want to be engaged, making my day-to-day pretty easy (but still busy).
cons: Typical fast pace of a start-up and processes are constantly changing. No 401k or tuition reimbursement yet. Also, limited time off.

headline: Zoom is Second to None.
pros: I love everything about working at Zoom.  The culture at Zoom is better than anything I have ever experienced, and our CEO truly strives to deliver happiness to our customers and employees.   I come from other companies in the space and I know I made the right move based on the excellence of our product, our customers, our partners, and our employees.  I look forward to coming into work everyday.
cons: I would say lack of physical space to work in, we are growing so quickly that we need to expand our real estate.

headline: Technical Support Engineer
pros: A very fun community of co workers willing to help each other and make sure customers get solutions and answers they need. Work is fast but at a good pace, and not a usual "call center" experience.  Hands-on learning is encouraged, and you will learn quickly as your team helps and you see real world examples. Fun team building events are quarterly and lots of chances to improve yourself are available.
cons: Working from a satellite office from the main office includes some communication issues, but they are minimal and do not impact your daily work.

headline: Sir Account Executive
pros: Its a great place to work. All of my co workers love their job as much as I do.  Our product is constantly improving.
cons: The hiring process was very long. The period between interviews was too long.

headline: Amazing Company & People
pros: Great people, great product, great culture! Some of the most trustworthy leadership I've personally worked under.
cons: Typical small problems associated with a growing org but management seems to take care of everything so not a major concern.

headline: Account Executive
pros:
Zoom is a great blend of a very quick moving startup that has the maturity of an established organization as we are managed and lead by executives and organizational leaders that have been there and done that. It is truly a place of work where I enjoy coming in everyday. I strive to do my best each and every time for my customers; which in turn, allows me to execute for the company as a whole.

I'm am honored, blessed, and humbled to be working at a great company that is passionate about the product, the customers, and the employees!
cons: We are growing so quickly that the growing pains are showing. However, I take this as a positive as we have thus far been able to overcome these challenges and show improvement in all areas of growth.

headline: SALES EXECUTIVE
pros: Salary, culture/ leadership that's soooo good it's hard to believe and the very best product in the market
cons: With growth sometimes there are internal " growing pains "

headline: My Favorite Job Ever
pros: Amazing culture and people, incredible leadership (especially our CEO), a lot of opportunity to collaborate with leadership and make an impact, catered lunches and other perks. The product is really strong, customers rave about it and it's a great feeling to be proud of your product. The company is growing and seeing a tremendous amount of success.
cons: Salaries are not the most competitive in the Bay Area, opportunities for promotion can be scarce, limited remote flexibility. These could change soon but so far no 401k matching and limited PTO

headline: Account Executive
pros: There are many reasons why Zoom is an exceptional company, from the product and vision of its incredible founder to the well-organized training and on-going support provided. I love being at Zoom because the company is full of life and energy (much like a start-up), which is one of the reasons contributing to our success and growth. But the biggest factor for why Zoom so unique is because of the amazing motto we live and work by daily: delivering happiness to our customers.  All of the reviews on Glassdoor that state how awesome Zoom's culture is are 110% accurate and reflective of what it is like to work with the most supportive, intelligent, humble, charismatic, customer-centric, and driven workforces around. The sky is the limit for some companies, but at Zoom, we are reaching for the stars and getting closer every day!
cons: Processes change on a regular basis, but it is because we are routinely improving operational efficiency and seeking better workflows/systems to make everyone more productive.

headline: Account Executive Enterprise
pros: Great Sales Tools, Great Engineers, Great Platform ie the best SAAS video communication platform built, amazing network elasticity built with mobile first, Leadership Team is step and step with the customers, sellers, buyers and they listen.
cons: This company is doing all the right things!  Amazing culture!

headline: Couldn't Be Happier!
pros: Where do I begin.. Zoom truly is an amazing company to work for. The culture here speaks for itself. I truly enjoy coming into work every single day, and getting to work with such an amazing team of individuals. Everyone is so helpful, intelligent, and always willing to help. The leadership and management is inspiring, and is always available, no matter their position. You can always reach out to management without permission, and they always respond with insightful, helpful, and great advice and help. The benefits are outstanding, and I truly feel like I am more than just an employee here, I have a sense of belonging and a "family" feel to Zoom. If given the opportunity, I would take it 10/10 times!!
cons: I would not put this as a "con" in my outlook, but some others might consider it a "con" to work in such a fast growing, rapidly changing environment. I love every second of it, but if you are not ready for the "startup" environment, this might not be the place for you. But I truly do not have any "cons" for Zoom. I love it here.

headline: Happy place to work at
pros: I've been working in Zoom for half a year and I love the simplicity while aiming to deliver happiness culture of Zoom .Everyone is so nice and willing to help you whenever you need it. The mail goal of the company is delivering happiness to everyone to our customers, our employees and our communities, etc. If you are looking for a place you can find your clear career path while enjoy it.Come to Zoom!
cons: Though we already have three fabulous free lunch weekly, we'll be thrilled to have free lunch for the whole week:)

headline: A fantastic evolution to an existing product.
pros:
Just joined Zoom a couple months ago, but I have been in the web conference space for over 10 years.  

Zoom is exactly the kind of company I was looking for in my exhaustive job search. It has the family feel that makes communication flow easily between teams and departments. The CEO is genuine and cares for your personal and professional development.  As I meet other teams to understand their needs, it's very refreshing to see that we're all working toward a common goal.  We are growing together as a family, and working as a company to deliver happiness.  

Thank you Zoom :)
cons: The only con I find so far is having to wait to see what the future holds for all of us.

headline: Enterprise Sales
pros: I find it pretty unique to work at a place where you know 100% in your heart that the company is moving in the right direction and changing the world in such a beautiful way. It's really hard to describe how positive of a working environment and company culture Zoom has, but let me try to put it this way... I have worked at a number of companies, where I've held this exact same role,  and this is the very first time where I've found myself getting excited on Sundays because I know that THE WORK WEEK IS ABOUT TO START UP AGAIN. Almost bewildering...
cons: As we continue to grow and hire more people, it's going to require more of a commitment from each individual to preserve the culture that makes this place so special.

headline: Awesome Company to work for!
pros:
Been at Zoom for about 2.5 years now. 

- Culture is amazing
- Friendly employees, managers and executives
- The company is always working on bettering it's employees via sales trainings, team meetings and more. 
- Easy to work your way up through the ranks
- Product is amazing so it's easy to be passionate about your work. And if you're in sales, the product practically sells itself!
cons: -Not really any cons working here. One of the best companies I have ever worked for :)

headline: Sales
pros: Great culture, welcoming environment. Best company that I have ever worked for and I have been in sales for over 20 years. Product is fantastic and people love Zoom.
cons: There isn't anything that I would complain about.

headline: Everything you've heard is true!
pros: The management from the top down really strive to keep a 1 of a kind culture. Everyone loves to come to work and is smiling all day.
cons: They are growing probably too quickly. There are already some signs that they may be getting in over there head. However this small red flag is waaaaaaay worth the risk.

headline: Mid Market Account Executive
pros:
Where to begin:  CEO is a truly caring and thoughtful person.  He went out of his way to come by my cube just to see how I was doing and I thought that was awesome.  He encourages anyone at anytime to reach out to him directly with ideas/thoughts to help Zoom become better so you don't get that "top down" structure - its very linear and all execs are accessible.   

Its from our CEO that the culture emanates from - "happiness".  People here are really happy and you feel like its "your family" after the first few weeks.  

The product is second to none.  Its shows well and is so superior to anything else in our space that you feel incredibly proud.  The Zoom engineers never take their foot off the gas either and the innovations they are making to Zoom make selling it super-fun.  

Training I thought was executed flawlessly.  I felt great coming out of it.  The people around me have been so helpful and with such a collaborative product, getting a hold of anyone within the company for help is a click of the mouse.
cons: Its hard to be critical of a company doing pretty much everything right.  Obviously with such fast growth, there will be those growing pains but I'm not going to knock the company for that. We're growing because we're WINNING and people love our product. Can't find any fault in that.

headline: Zoom is the real deal
pros: Competitive pay,  quarterly bonus plan, leadership who are willing to adapt and change. Free lunch three days a week. Great vibes from the CEO down to the newest employee.
cons: No  401K yet, good, but not great benefits. Not much PTO (but this is supposed to change soon.)

headline: Highly touted, still better than I expected.
pros:
INCREDIBLE product that customers adore. Zoom works every time with amazing quality and is the clear leader in the space. 
Pound for pound, Zoom has the most talented people I've ever worked with. Best part is, the culture of sharing knowledge and mentorship to new blood is genuine and far surpassed any experience I had previously. There is a selflessness about teamwork here that doesn't exist anywhere else I've worked. I feel excited to come to work every day. Our CEO and President always keep their doors open to us...they listen and take care of the employees here very well. Our roadmap is largely defined by our customers and their feature requests, so happy customers make for happy employees!
cons: Lots of great tools to learn. Processes are getting better and faster all the time.

headline: Account Executive
pros:
There is a family like culture, where everyone is ready to help.  The pay is great and room for growth is offered as long as you are willing to hustle and prove yourself. Lunch is provided a majority of the week with water and other snacks provided everyday. 

Great Benefits
Fast Growing Company - Endless Opportunity 
Leadership is Great - No Micromanagement 
You want to come to work everyday
cons:
No 401K Match 
No Tuition Reimbursement 
12 Days of PTO - However supposed to change come 2018

headline: Awesome!
pros: Zoom genuinely cares for its employees. The people are nice and willing to help. The leadership is transparent and forward thinking.  If you're looking to grow yourself with the company this is the place to be!
cons: None really...but if I had to say the cons are what any other fast growing company goes through (which can be a good thing). Like any growing company the workload can build up and can also be challenging at times, but personally it has been a tremendous development and growth opportunity that I have not gotten at any other company.

headline: Sales Recruiter - Talent Acquisition
pros: Job and career opportunities, good culture that we've been able to maintain, top notch Executive leaders and managers across the board, investment in employees with continued and consistent internal training, team oriented/ supportive and collaborative work environment, lunch catered 3x a week (I've never worked for a company that does this), the coolest backpacks for our laptops (that matters), great location, and overall a good place to come to every day. Zoom does a good job taking care of their employees.
cons: The usual growing pains, which is not really a Con. At all. It's a good problem to have.

headline: 6 year Start-Up
pros: Appears to engage employees in creating "happiness" for customer base and fosters fun in the workplace.
cons: Sometimes see inconsistency in messaging values and living them out

headline: Delivering Happiness to Customers and Employees
pros:
The company if very employee/customer centric, with the notion that if employees are happy, they will deliver happiness to the customers, which in turn, will create a successful business.  This comes directly from the CEO, President and other Executives, and it's created a culture that is very fun to work in.

Right now, Zoom is growing rapidly with success and leadership has the strong belief to continue innovating the product to keep ahead of the curve.  Unlike other products in the market who have been stagnate for some time, CEO, Eric Yuan, preaches we must always be paranoid that someone will catch up to us.  It's this type of leadership that allows Zoom to continue to raise the bar in it's performance. 

I'm very excited to come to work everyday, as all of my colleagues are inclusive and willing to help a fellow colleague out.  You'll never felt like you're out on an island, not knowing what to do.
cons:
-  Zoom is a startup company that is rapidly growing.  This combination means there's a lot of changes in processes and tools, which can be hard to keep up with.  A person must be flexible and able to pivot quickly when working in this environment.

-  Zoom is becoming big enough where internal decision making has slowed a bit.  I still think Zoom acts faster that most companies, though I started when there were many less employees and (for instance) could go directly to a support / operations team member to help push something through.  Now there are a lot more internal checks & balances that have slowed us down.

headline: Finance
pros: Great environment, Happy people, Tuesday and Thursday catered lunches, flexible working hours, no politics, Eric is such a great personality.
cons: limited PTO but they make it unlimited soon

headline: The hype is very real. No Kool-Aid necessary.
pros: There is huge room for career growth here. Every month and quarter, there are new roles that open up in new segments and business functions. Like anywhere else, it's what you bring to the table and the genuine relationships you build with people that matter most. Zoom is no different in that regard. That being said, there is (almost) zero office politics here. The leaders and people here truly care and want you to succeed, whatever career path you want. I've felt supported and valued from Day 1, and have never felt that I was competing for attention with my peers. Zoom gives you a voice and they listen that voice. The pay and compensation is above average for the industry and respective regions. The management structure is very flat and leaders are so very accessible & approachable. The culture here and onboarding is very unique. I can't speak highly enough of it, it's just something you've got to experience yourself to understand. If you join the rocketship that is Zoom, don't worry about where you're sitting - we're all going to the moon. Don't come here if you're not ready to hustle though - We don't work 40-hour weeks, and that's surprisingly not a "Con" at all.
cons:
The Cons are few, but they're there. No 401k match or tuition reimbursement.
Only 12 days of PTO (!?) But that will likely be changing to some degree soon enough.

headline: Sales Development Representative
pros: Amazing leadership from the CEO to sales managers. The culture of Zoom is one big family, easy to find support and guidance.
cons: High growth company means an ever changing landscape.

headline: Everything it's made out to be
pros:
-People care about you first
-Delivering happiness to clients is CEO's mission
-Leadership team empowers you to be successful
-No micromanagement
-Fast growing company
-Happiness crew plans monthly/quarterly events
-Best product in the market
-Fun sales process
-Utilize product everyday
-Optimistic/Energetic environment
-People are loyal 
-Incredible benefits package
-Training/on-boarding is well organized
cons:
-No 401k match
-No tuition reimbursement
-Many sales applications to learn
-Still a startup company so learn as you go

headline: Business Development Rep / Previous SDR
pros:
Culture to care about yourself, each other, and your customers. 
Company events are a blast. 
The people you work with on daily share industries best practices and want to see everyone successful. 
Plenty of opportunities to grow!
cons: Currently there is no matching 401k

headline: Always Delivering Happiness
pros:
Awesome company culture
Supportive management
Good pay and benefits
Product is solid, so it is easy to sell and support
Lots of opportunities to learn and engage with senior product engineers
Hard work is acknowledged publicly to others in the company
The company wants the employee to be happy so that they can make the customers happy
cons:
As with any customer service job sometimes customers get angry, but it is rewarding to try and deliver happiness to those types of customers as well.
Occasional paid weekend shifts are expected
Remote offices don't have as much opportunity for advancement or movement within the company.

headline: Unbelievable culture
pros: The people, by far. They make sure to hire great people from top to bottom, ensuring the culture remains amazing in every office. They take care of each and every individual. An absolute joy to work for
cons: None as of yet. Continue on the same pace

headline: Great Company
pros: Great environment & very team based. Management is very accessible and willing to help. They truly care about the employees, customer, and product!
cons: None. This place is amazing! They take such good care of the employees. They are so willing to adopt and grow!

headline: I know Zoom sounds too good to be true but it truly is an incredible place to be!
pros:
Though we've grown a lot in the past 5 years, we still have the startup feel and adaptability. 

LOVE what we sell and Zoom's genuine customer focus. 

The culture is fun and collaborative (we sell collaboration software, shocker)...

Management has been well-chosen and extremely supportive, and when a position is not a good fit, Zoom is great about helping you find the right fit for each person, where they are not only successful, but also happy.
cons: It is a VERY high-paced job, especially in certain segments. Though management is flexible with hours, you can expect long days (think 9-11 hours).

headline: Sales Development
pros: Confidence in the product, Helpful managers, Trust in the employees, Happiness is always delivered, A CEO that cares about culture and customer happiness above all else, a tool that customers enjoy using, fun people and everyone is extremely selfless and helpful.
cons: Start-up life, it's either for you or it's not. If you can adjust quickly on the fly than there are no cons here.

headline: The best company I have ever worked for!!!
pros: I have to admit, when I got the call for an interview and looked Zoom up on Glassdoor, I was thinking "yeah right, there is no way all of the employees LOVE their job THAT much." Almost a year later here I am writing my review and giving it 5 stars! I feel SO lucky to be apart of this amazing company. Not only is the company growing at 300%+ YOY, but I could not ask for a better culture and team to work with. I moved out to Denver specifically for this job and it has been the best decision I have made in a long time. The pay is very competitive and there is TONS of opportunity to grow and be promoted within. Did I mention the culture??? From happy hours, to white water rafting trips, we have a GREAT culture out in the Denver office and I am proud to say that I look forward to going to work every day. And to top it all off, we get to sell the BEST product on the market! Pinch me, this must be a dream, seriously.
cons: I honestly don't have anything bad to say (first time in my life) about this company.

headline: Love it here
pros: The best place to work,
cons: Non that i can think of.

headline: Dream Job!
pros: I thought that I had had jobs in the past where the company really cared about its employees - but after working at Zoom my outlook on that completely changed! They truly want you to succeed and you are given everything at your disposal to help you do so. The people and the culture really make this a place that you look forward to going into work every day. I truly feel so blessed to have found this company!
cons: I have nothing negative to say!

headline: Zoom is the best job I've had
pros: This is a company who cares about their employees. On top of that, there are so many opportunities for growth along with the company. The company culture is very open where anyone who has any ideas on how things can improve will be heard. I've had hour long conversations with our software engineers on new application feature ideas that I've had, and my role at the company has absolutely nothing to do with software development. This company cares. Eric Yuan, the CEO, makes sure to seek out new ideas from his employees and is always very gracious when employees show dedication to the company. I wouldn't want to be working anywhere else.
cons: Long hours. Don't come to work for Zoom unless you believe in this company. You can expect some very long days and weekends every now and then.

headline: Fast-paced but fun work environment
pros: The work is collaborative, and the company culture allows for cross-functional projects
cons: The startup workspace means constant change and movement of employees into different groups

headline: There is no where else I'd rather be
pros: Amazing culture. I have been at Zoom for almost 4 years now and I can tell you that there is no where else I would rather be. My CEO has the biggest heart and truly cares for his employees. He's a first time CEO but his mentors have really help guide him when needed. He has built the best engineering team which separates us from our competitors. We have risen to a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant and because our software is better than our competitors it makes selling easy and thus I can't complain about comp.
cons: Since we are growing so rapidly we are building new processes. Not everyone always agrees with the new processes but if this is the only thing I can complain about leadership must be doing something right!

headline: Sales Executive
pros: Start from the top down at Zoom and what you get is an organization that is truly passionate about "delivering happiness" to its customers, both inside and outside the company walls. I've had the privilege of working for a handful of good companies, but this company and its culture take the cake. Furthermore, the product is simply phenomenal and the passion it brings out of me has LITERALLY changed my life. Nope, we're not a cult...we're Zoom!
cons: Nothing outside of some typical "startup" growing-pains. Processes can seem to change overnight, however, every change has been a result of the failure of a certain way of doing things, and the desire to fix things and make them better.

headline: Account Executive
pros:

- Technology that is disrupting the market in a major way.

headline: Zoom away with me! Seriously!  😀
